intro: Sideritis perfoliata subsp. athoa, commonly known as Greek violet or Athos violet, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its violet-blue flowers and hairy, opposite leaves that often appear to be fused around the stem. The plant thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is typically found in dry, sunny habitats. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. Sideritis perfoliata subsp. athoa is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
